0.text: Humans have existed for millions of years, as part of nature.

5.text: But then, something changed. And in an incredibly short amount of time..

9.text: ..We terraformed this planet and designed it to fit our needs.

14.text: As far as we know, we're the first beings to awaken and completely take over a planet.

20.text: The transition from hunting and gathering to farming and building, was so breathtakingly fast,

25.text: that many of our ways of thinking about the world are no longer useful.

30.text: One of our most outdated ideas is that the most commonly used calendar in the world insists that we live in the year of 2016.

38.text: This distorts our view of our own history, and makes it harder to understand who we are as a species,

43.text: and just how far we have come in an incredibly short amount of time.

48.text: So, maybe it's time to choose a Year 0 for humanity.

52.text: A Year 0 that truly represents us as a species and includes all cultures,

57.text: a Year 0 that marks when we began building our own world on top of the old one.

76.text: 12,000 years ago hundreds of humans came together in the hills of southern Anatolia.

81.text: They were hunters and gatherers without the knowledge of agriculture or metalworking.

86.text: All they had were tools made of stone and wood,

89.text: but they built humanity's first big construction project..

92.text: ..7,000 years before the pyramids were built in Egypt.

97.text: Spread over 300 meters our ancestors erected circles of massive stone pillars,

102.text: each of them up to 6 meters high and 40 tons in weight.

106.text: Decorated with art for pictograms and stone carvings of animals and mythical creatures.

111.text: We have no idea how they were able to do this.

114.text: It was probably a project of epic scale for the Stone Age, requiring a level of organization we didn't know..

120.text: ..early humans were capable of until we found this site.

125.text: So, why did they build it?

127.text: The most popular theory is that this was the first temple of humanity dedicated to long-forgotten Gods.

135.text: We only know that this construction project, the 1st-of-its-kind marks the beginning of a new era.

142.text: It's in this area, around that time, that humans truly began to build their own world.

148.text: Which would make it a fitting milestone in our history, for the start of our calendar.

154.text: This moment in time is so distinct, that scientist Cesare Emiliani proposed that humanity..

160.text: ..should switch to what he called the Holocene calendar, by adding 10,000 years to our current Gregorian calendar.

168.text: We don't need to change our well-established days and months,

171.text: and religious calendars could stay the same as well.

174.text: But for all official purposes, our current year will be the year 12,016 of the human era.

181.text: This would drastically alter how we think about history, and how it feels.

366.text: And it's only now around the year 10,000, that we've reached the point where the Gregorian calendar

371.text: and our current method of marking human history begins.

376.text: A mere 2,000 years from now, humans will walk on the moon.

380.text: If we think about history as we do now, we are underplaying 10,000 years of human progress and development.
